item.title: Remembering The Tillerman: A Vintage Las Vegas Steakhouse Oasis
item.description:
A Refuge from the Neon: Introducing The Tillerman

Las Vegas. The name conjures images of dazzling lights, elaborate shows, and world-class dining on the Strip. But beyond the spectacle, a quieter, more reliable Vegas existed - one where locals and those seeking a less-frenzied experience could gather. Enter The Tillerman, a steak & seafood restaurant that, for over three decades, was a beloved fixture on East Flamingo Road (2245 E. Flamingo Rd.). Opened in 1980, it wasnâ€™t striving to be the loudest, flashiest destination; instead, it carved out a niche as a haven of classic comfort.
